title: Famous Singers Ask for Help with Ticket Prices
summary: Dua Lipa and Coldplay are famous singers who care about their fans. They signed a letter to the government because they want to stop ticket touts. Ticket touts are people who buy tickets and then sell them for much higher prices. This makes it hard for fans to afford tickets to concerts. The singers promised to cap resale prices, which means they want to set a limit on how much tickets can be resold for. By asking the government to take action, they hope to make concert tickets fair for everyone. This is important because it helps fans enjoy music without paying too much money. The article shows how celebrities can use their voice to make positive changes in the world.

background_read: This article is about famous musicians like Dua Lipa and Coldplay who are trying to help their fans. Ticket touts are a problem because they buy tickets and sell them for much more money, making it hard for regular fans to go to concerts. The singers wrote a letter to the government, which is the group that makes laws, asking them to do something about it. They want to cap resale prices, which means putting a maximum price on how much tickets can be resold for. This is part of a bigger effort to make sure everyone has a fair chance to enjoy live music without being overcharged. Understanding this helps us see how people can work together to solve problems in society.
